{{also|Neun}} ==German== {{cardinalbox|de|8|9|10|acht|zehn|ord=neunte}} ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|goh|de}} {{m|goh|niun}}, from {{etyl|gem-pro|de}} {{m|gem-pro|*newun}}, from {{etyl|ine-pro|de}} {{m|ine-pro|*h₁néwn̥}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|negen}}, {{cog|en|nine}}, {{cog|fy|njoggen}}, {{cog|da|ni}}, {{cog|got|𐌽𐌹𐌿𐌽}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/nɔʏ̯n/}} * {{audio|de|De-neun.ogg|audio}} ===Numeral=== {{head|de|numeral}} # {{cln|de|cardinal numbers}} [[nine]] {{gloss|numerical value represented by the Arabic numeral 9; or ''describing a set with nine elements''}} #* Martin Luther, trans., Bible, Gospel of Luke 17:17, #*: „Wo sind aber die '''neune'''?“ #*:: “Where are the other '''nine'''?” ====Coordinate terms==== {{de-cardinal}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|neunschwänzige Katze}} * {{l|de|neunzehn}} * {{l|de|neunzig}} * {{l|de|alle Neune}} * {{l|de|neunmalklug}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}}
